metadata.synopsis: This film presents the real-life tale of young Ruby Bridges (Chaz Monet), one of the first African-American children to attend an integrated school in the Deep South. At only age 6, Ruby is selected to attend an all-white school in New Orleans, causing an uproar in the racially divided region. Among the people who try to help Ruby adjust to the tense situation are teacher Barbara Henry (Penelope Ann Miller) and Dr. Robert Coles (Kevin Pollak), a child psychiatrist.

reviews: Historical drama lacks subtlety but has positive messages.
What sets this film apart from its typically treacly ilk is the the strong, subtle work by the cast.
An inspiring film about an exceptional black girl whose Christian faith and spiritual resiliency are a lesson for all of us.
As Ruby, Chaz Monet captures the child's happiness and sadness, fear and fortitude, with genuine subtlety.
Ruby is an inspiring and cute little girl. The film revisits a shameful past and shows what a powerful force moral fortitude can be, even in a child.
